text: Bottle at Højbjerg tasting. Pours dark chestnut brown with a small off-white to beige head. Aroma of malt, fruit, yeast, plum, prune and raisin. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness, touch of sour. Medium body, oily texture, average to soft carbonation.

Bottle @ Johns. Pours very dark amber with a light tan head. Aroma of malt, light caramel, light sourness, wood, tart oak, balsamico, light vinegar, dried fruit. Flavor is light sweet, light sour, malty, caramel, wet wood, oak, balsamico, dried fruit. Medium body, average carbonation, sweet and light sour finish. 8-4-7-4-16. 170617

Botte. Frothy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty nand light hoppy sour aroma. Moderate bitter slightly sour flavor. Some sweet notes. Average light bitter finish. oily palate.
Bottle @ Højbjerg tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are lactose acid, brett, fruits, wood, malt and hops. Nice sour finish.

Bottle @ Saxo tasting. Vintage 2016. Light hazy dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark fruit, tart fruit, wood and sherry. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 170617

Bottle at Monterey Bar. Pours... Dark, cant see more than that. Aroma is sherry barrel, light funk, berries. Body is heavy, lots of sherry, quite some booze, lightly acidic, rather sweet, barrel. Lingering boozy barrel palate. Good!
Bottle at Cott Botts; dark mahogany brown pour with a creamy tan head, aroma has Dr Pepper treacle, some wine, taste has coffee, some liquorice, some vinous.

bottle. pours brown/mahogany with average beige head that stays on the glass. aroma of sherry, dark fruits, malts and hops. the taste is quite tannic, perceptible sour and aging notes from the barrel with average to high bitterness. carbnation is average. really good beer

Bottle into a tulip. Pours a deep mahogany, with a moderate khaki head that lasts. Decent lacing. Nose is dark roast malt, cocoa, and a hint of sherry. Taste follows, with a very rich dark malt base, notes of balsamic vinegar, and a delightful sherry finish. Excellent
Fruta roja, madera quemada, setas, tierra. Acidez afrutada, final de amargor ligeramente achocolstado y regusto muy largo de Acidez achocolstado.

Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma has malts, almost hvidtøl-like, sour oak, like a mild Oude bruin. Reminds a little bit of a lighter aardnun. The taste is fairly ballanced with both fruity, malty and sour flavours and a little drying oak in the aftertaste. Has some vintage beer qualities, old books and such.
Jak dobry Flanders ze sporym ciałem, względnie niezbyt wysoką kwasowością, sporo ciemnych owoców, cierpkie, pyszne.
Butelka. Ciekawe piwo, niby Old ale ale przypomina znacznie Flandersa. Jest owocowo, lekko kwasnie, fajnie taniczne.

Rami Rami is drinking an Old Dishoom by American Solera at Chmielarnia Marszałkowska

Bardzo dobry, owocowy, nieco rodzynkowy flanders jakby z lekka przyprawowoscia. Troche beczkowy. bdb+

sample from bottle, poured a amber colour with a off head. nose is sweet and sour, caramel notes, tartness, yeast, sweet cherries, cinnamon from cherry pits, vineous almost porto like notes, chewy, toffee, light tart notes in the finish. nice
BGM Backlog. Great complexity! Sherry, pineapple, light vinegar, caramel, oak, barnyard. Moderate sour, moderate sweet, tart.

Wspaniałe piwo pite po raz pierwszy z tego browaru. Aromat owocowy złożony, wisienki i inne owoce także cytrusowe, smak orzeźwiający, bardzo przyjemne na podniebieniu, mistrzostwo świata no może wice.
Rozlewane na Beer Geek Madness. Świetne, złożone piwo, beczka nie gra pierwszych skrzypiec, tylko uzupełnia old ale potraktowane dzikusami.
Thanks Carl! Mildly sour, lots of caramel, dark fruit, and oak barrels. Medium bodied and nice sipper. Solid beer.

4/2/17. Bottle thanks to Carl! Amber pour with a nice khaki head. Rich aroma of dark fruits, caramel, barrel, a hint of tart? Good flavor, mildly sour, not sure if on purpose, but it works, dark fruits, caramel. Tasty!

Bottle @ Mig & Ølsnedkeren, 8.5% shared with Nick & Co. Hazy dark brown with tiny beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, oak, wood, dark fruit, sour fruit and a little vinegar. Flavour is malt, caramel, oak, wood, notes of sherry, sour fruit, medium sweet, little dry, dark fruit and medium bitter.

Bottle. Hazy chestnut brown with a medium sized light brown slowly diminishing head. Sour nose with dark wood, lemon, dust and chocolate. The flavour has minerals, light salt, dark wood, dust, chocolate, tobacco and earthy notes. Medium to full body, milky texture, medium sweet, mild bitter and sour with some tannins. Long finish with dark wood, tobacco and tannins.
375ml bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Lots of plum flavor. Sherry flavor prominent and lingers.
Bottle pour at RB Best. It pours a deep brown color. The aroma has lots of sherry, almond and a little toast. The flavor has more sherry with some noticeable wood. Smooth on the palate. Decent.

Thank you Travlr! 375 ml. bottle sampled. Dark amber, tanned bubbles, not much carbonation visible. Nose is old wine, rotting barrel, wine leaves, fermenting cherries, sherry is massive, giving it a huge oxidized feel. Little carbonation, almost watery, huge sherry notes, barrel treatment, makes this almost feel like a very old BE brew / malty sherry hybrid, walnuts, very heavy sherry, old barrel, rotting wood, dark fruits, cherry pits. Interesting brew, good stuff.
Bottle from the source shared at Beerlovers Bar Antwerp. Clearish amber brown color. Port wine aroma. Taste id vinous grapes and port. Beautiful.
Thnx to gene. Pours dark brown. Smell is full, mild sour, taste is full, malty, bit sour touch, very full. I like this

Bottle @ RateBeer Best 2017. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy woody sherry aroma with hints of caramel. Fruity malty woody sherry caramel flavor with weak tart hints. Has a fruity malty woody sherry caramel finish.
[1/28/17] Bottle/Draught at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Brown. Caramel, malt, cookies, nuts, chocolate, sweet, slightly tart. Very nice.
375 ml. bottle. Pours reddish brown with a decent beige head. Aroma of fruit, wine, and wood. Taste is Sherry barrel, fruit, spice, and wood. Very tasty.

375 ml bottle shard, purchased at Bottles & Bitters at Sloans Lake. Deep reddish brown appearance with a beige head. Aroma of wine, dark fruits, caramel, toasted oak, light spice and light vanilla. Similar flavor, rich, vinous, fruity and sweet with a lingering finish. Medium to full body. A nice sipper overall.

375 ml bottle. The beer is a nice deep mahogany color. Maybe a bit cloudy but hard to tell. Small beige-ish head, a bit fizzy. Tons of sherry barrel flavor. It pretty much overwhelms the other flavors. Big vinous notes with a good deal of spice. Lots of oak. Some caramel, molasses. It seems like theres a nice toasty malt base but its a bit hard to find underneath the sherry barrel. Fairly sweet but that spicy, oaky, grapey action is the main star in the taste, as well. Its hard to stay entirely away from harsher territory with all of that barrel, but its mostly managed here. Pretty smooth, at least relatively to the flavor. Oak bitterness in the finish. Medium body.

@RBB
Wine and toffee, sweet and boozy for an 8% beer. Malt and leather and oak. OK.
Bottle thanks to Jared. Pours a very dark brown with medium beige head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong toffee, oak, grape. Medium body, similar flavors to nose, nice sweetness, very good.
